itemDescription: Welsh rugby union and rugby league footballer

wikipedia_page.main: William Harold Johnson (first ¼ 1916 – 13 June 1997) was a Welsh rugby union and  professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1930s. He played club level rugby union (RU) for Pill Harriers RFC and Newport RFC, and representative level rugby league (RL) for Wales and England, and at club level for Huddersfield, as a wing, or scrum-half, i.e. number 2 or 5, or 7.
